course.subject: SBMT
course.name: Community Services Project: Underwater Robot Community Engagement Project
course.description: This course is offered in a form of a community project at a designated non-governmental organization (NGO) under the supervision of the School. Students are required to attend all the training sessions, design and implement the service project or participate in the service learning tasks as instructed by the host NGO and/or the course instructors. By the end of the course, students have to submit a reflective statement in the format of a paper, a group project report or a presentation to demonstrate the attainment of all intended learning outcomes, in addition to other requirements of the relevant NGO as appropriate. Approval from the course coordinator is needed prior to enrolling in the course. Graded PP, P or F. Students may repeat the course for credits if different topics are taken.

reviews.author: Dicky123
reviews.title: Good Grade Course, making a lot of friends too
reviews.comment_content:
This course will teach students to learn more about STEAM skills, especially for underwater robots. For example, we will try to understand the basics of buoyancy, Newton's law, and investigate the structures of the underwater robots. In our course, we often abbreviate underwater robots as UWR, just in case you come accross this short form.

You will also learn from various NGO on how to communicate with Special Education Needs (SEN students), in which you have to be patient and repeat the keywords with certain amount of facial and body gesture to deliver the messages clearly to them.
reviews.comment_teaching: The support from the tutors and professors, as well as from NGO is excellent. Very easy to understand, clear powerpoints are made. You can also make a Whatsapp group, WeChat group, Discord or Skype to chat with your teammates on your findings.
reviews.comment_grading:
It is a very good grade course, basically if you attend the classes on time (since it requires us to take screenshots on zoom)
You also have to prepare the teaching materials.
If all these works have proper inputs, then your effort will pay off
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light workload. Just some powerpoint slides, and meetings with your groupmates.
No mid term exam, no final exam, no homework, no assignment, no quiz, zoom quizzes do not count towards your grade, no need to write any papers or essays. No extra reading materials
Just some presentations, projects and attendance takings

reviews.author: v.v.v
reviews.title: Community Engagement Focused
reviews.comment_content:
Role and Responsibilities of HKUST Students
• To complete the deliverables as stated in the syllabus
• To prepare reports and conduct presentations as required
• To keep close contact with the Project Supervisor and School’s Project Coordinator
• To keep track on the project progress and ensure the deliverables to be ready on time
• To keep all data, information, analyses and recommendations confidential if requested by HKUST
• To represent themselves and the HKUST in a professional manner
• To ensure all students contribute equally to the project
• To prepare a self-reflective paper describing his/her learning experience at the conclusion of the project
reviews.comment_teaching: The professors and the staffs are very supportive. They really care about every student and participant.
reviews.comment_grading:
Two-credit course, graded Pass or Fail.
-
1 Self-reflective Paper, together with a minimum of six digital photos taken during the course of the project
2 Email Reports on progress update
1􏰀 Program and Peer Evaluation Forms
-
Very easy to meet the requirement.
reviews.comment_workload:
It's a little bit annoying to spend your weekends.
You need to consider thoroughly if you're interested in community services, or you will find yourself struggling to wake up early and spend all Saturday or Sunday with the participants.
